texts.name: Mom
texts.text: And at the end of the long, long tunnel...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito saw the sea and the sky stretching as far as the eye can see. Seeing the beauty of nature extending out towards the horizon took his breath away. It was everything Kaito imagined and much, much more.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Countless creatures swam through the clear waters.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: The clouds rolled lazily across the sky, and white birds rode the winds with abandon.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: When Kaito took a deep breath, his chest was filled with the clean sea breeze.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It smelled just like the wind he had dreamed of so many times before.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: And for a moment, Kaito forgot all of the pain and suffering he had endured on his adventure. Finally, he had made it to his destination.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: The end.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy, the sea and the sky are big and blue, right? And they go on forever, right?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, they're so wide you can't see the end of them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But then how do we know where the sky ends and the sea starts?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Hmm, that's a good question. I've never seen them either!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The sky is air, and the sea is water, right?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, sweetie.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you think they're still above ground?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, I think so. The Earth used to be called the water planet.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ooh, the water planet?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Then if I make something so people can go outside, I can go and see them?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, I'm sure you can!
Mom closes the book.
"Kaito's Adventure".
That's the title of the book.
It's a picture book about a boy named Kaito who travels in search of the sea and the sky.
Mommy loves it, and I love it too.
One day, Mommy told me that she got my name from this book.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You want to see the sky and the sea too, right?
Mom smiles and nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll show them to you! I'll be an inventor when I grow up!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Wow!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm making a car right now.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: A car?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah! It's a machine people used to move around on the surface a long time ago.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: People can ride on it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm making a small car. But the way it works is the same, so if I make a big one, people can ride on it!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: That's amazing, sweetie! Mommy can't wait to see it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll show you when it works! It's not done yet.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Hehe.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll go warm up the food.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thanks, sweetie.
Our house was made by digging a big hole in the dirt and sticking sheet metal on the walls. That's why it's a little cramped.
There's only a bed, a dining table, the kitchen, and a washbasin.
Outside the window, all you can see is the cornfields, and past that, the earth wall on the opposite side.
All around us are more people living in their small clay houses like us.
I get some corn flour from the cupboard and mix it with water.
I knead it, make it round, and smash it flat.
Then I oil up the flat pan and arrange the dough on top of it.
I flip the electric switch to turn on the heater and start the tortilla frying, and then heat up the corn stew we got as rations.
Once they're ready, I serve the tortilla on a flat plate and the stew in a bowl.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's ready.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thank you.
Mom rests the tray on her lap and brings a spoonful of stew to her mouth.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Will you read me another book when you're done eating?
She smiles and nods in response.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, I'll see you later.
I pick up my bag and sling it over my shoulder.
Mom made the bag for me when she was still well.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Be careful out there.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll be back before it gets dark.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Okay.
I close the door, go up the dirt stairs, and come out onto the corn fields.
There's no wind down here.
I see some other downsiders heading up toward the middle like me.
I look up as I walk.
The round sky is there, like always.
And the faint outline of the wire grid as well.
The clouds are rolling by.
The wind may be blowing on the surface.
The clouds move because of the wind.
A lot of songs from when people lived up there long ago talk about the wind.
I'm sure it must have had some kind of meaning for people back then.
Lowering my gaze slightly, I see the neat, gleaming wall of the top side.
Below that, the middle side.
Then I turn my eyes straight ahead of me.
I can hear my footsteps on the ground.
Wind blows underground sometimes, but it's just the flow of air coming from the tunnels connecting to the next town.
There are no gently rolling clouds here.
It's just cold air moving around.
I wonder what it's like.
The feel of the wind on your face.
Having it ruffle your hair.
We...
We only know about it from what's written.
When I get up to the middle side, I go to see what work I've been assigned.
I get sent to help clean the eastern common area again today.
I take a broom and a dustpan then head to my assigned spot.
I look up at the monitor in the common area as I sweep the floor.
It displays the intensity of the UV rays on the surface.
The meter's up to the red part of the bar that means it's in the danger zone.
I've never seen it go down below the danger zone.
That's why we live underground.
On the top of the same screen is a bar that shows how much of the day's water ration has been consumed.
It's still morning, and it's already over 70\%.
Today is going to be another day where there isn't any water left by nightfall.
And then, the screen switches to an image of the surface.
Something red is moving along the brown earth.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah...
It's a car.
It's a video of a car.
I stop to stare at the video.
The wheels are turning really fast.
How do you make something move that fast?
And what are those shiny parts made of?
The scenery speeds by at a dizzying pace.
I've never seen something move that fast.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ouch!
Stop daydreaming and get cleaning.
Someone hits me on the back of the head.
I turn around to see a familiar pair.
It's Shachi and his android.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Sorry.
I turn my back on them and continue sweeping the stone floor.
But as soon as I do, he smacks the back of my head again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm working like I'm supposed to now. Why did you hit me?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Punishment for your stupid mom slacking off. She's getting rations without working, isn't she?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She's not slacking off... She can't move.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She got her exemption and everything.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Yeah, right. She's just pretending. That's why you're such a lazy idiot. Like mother, like son.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No.
The angrier I feel, the quieter my voice gets.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Says the boy skipping school.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No...

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: No what?! Huh?!
I realize I've stopped sweeping again and quickly resume my work.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Hmph. Lame.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Shame I gotta go to school. I sure I wish I was born to a family of slackers that let me do whatever I want.
With that last remark, he leaves.
I hear his footsteps growing distant.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Hey, Izumo! Stop standing around!
I can hear his voice, a good distance away now.
And after that, I hear the sound of Izumo's footsteps as she walks away.
I turn around and see her following Shachi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy isn't slacking off...
I mutter, my heart heavy with frustration.
But nobody hears me, and saying it doesn't make me feel any better.
I finish my morning shift, and then eat the rations I'm given for lunch while still standing up.
We often get boiled, mushy cornflakes.
I finish eating and go check in for the afternoon shift.
By this time, the downsider kids who have finished school are arriving at work as well.
I'm the only kid that's been working since the morning.
Our family isn't eating for free.
I do the work of two people.
That's why I go home with rations for both me and mommy.
The afternoon work I get assigned is the maintenance of the shared monitors.
We work together with adults when it's complicated work like that.
They replace some parts that were starting to wear down.
After cleaning up, we're tasked with collecting the garbage in bags and taking it down to the lower layer.
That's where the trash dump is.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah...
I notice some trash that wasn't here yesterday.
I dump my bag and start hunting around.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What is this?
I find a stick-shaped thing connected to a switch. When I press it, the stick vibrates a whole lot.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?
A small brush thing is lying nearby.
It looks like you could attach it to the top of the stick.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, a toothbrush?
I turn it on and off several times.
Each time, the stick vibrates and makes a funny sound.
I stow the stick part, the one that seems to be the main part of the toothbrush, in my bag.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is there anything else in here?
The topsiders and midsiders throw away all kinds of things that you can still use.
Every time I disassemble electrical appliances, I find parts that work.
It's how I get my hands on parts that you never usually see down here.
If I can gather enough electronic components to make something people would want, I can barter with them in the lower market.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hmm, is that all for today?
I get up and leave the dump.
Now that work is done for the day, I just have to wait until it's time to pick up the rations.
This is my little alone time.
I take the stick-shaped electric toothbrush out of my bag along with my screwdriver.
I insert the screwdriver into a gap in the thing's exterior, and the stick splits in two after applying some force.
Inside, I find a small green plate and two tubular pieces of metal.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's rusty...
The pieces of metal have brown spots on them.
When I press the switch, the small metal tubes begin shaking.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa!
I place the shaking part on the palm of my hand.
I notice a white plastic piece at the tip of the cylinder. When I touch it, the shaking stops.
There's some resistance, I think.
When I let go, it starts shaking again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, so it's supposed to spin? It's shaking because the middle part is out of place.
I turn the switch off and remove the plastic from the tip.
When I turn it on again, the part produces an even louder noise and turns around faster.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe...
I could use this to make wheels turn.
If I attach a wheel to the end of this, it could make a wheel move like what I saw on the monitor today.
I pull out a small wheel from my bag.
I found it some time ago while looking through garbage in the dump.
I also take out a bit of putty I got while helping repair a water pipe in the middle side.
I put some putty inside the small hole in the wheel, and then insert the rotating cylinder.
I hold it together until it hardens and then let go.
It's fixed in place now.
Then, I turn it on.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's spinning!
I'm so happy I shout.
The wheel spins rapidly.
Just like I saw in the video. It's so fast that I can't even see the pattern in the wheel anymore.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So if I can put three more of these together...
I can make a moving car!
This is my first step towards becoming an inventor.
I smile at my little spinning wheel.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's amazing....

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah...
The bell that signals it's time to pick up the rations rings.
I put the tools and parts back in my bag and run to the middle side square.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Hey, Kaito! You manage to fix it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, it works now.
Some days ago, the nice old man that helps distribute the rations asked me to repair the flashlight he keeps attached to his belt.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The light bulb was dead, so I replaced it with one I picked up in the dump.
I hand it over, and he flips the switch to make sure it works. When the light comes on, he smiles at me.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Oh, you're a lifesaver! I can't walk the tunnels without my little pal here.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: What can I help you with today?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'd like some soap for washing hair. The one that smells nice and you don't need to use water with.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Soap? Sure thing. And here's today's rations. For you and your mom.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Don't drop them now! Good work, sonny.
After receiving the rations, I hurry back home.
Mommy's waiting for me.
I have lots of things to tell her about today.
I run all the way back home every day, since I know she's waiting.
I want to see her as soon as possible too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm back!
When I open the door, Mom turns to me and smiles.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Welcome home. Did you work hard today, sweetie?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah! Are you hungry?
She slowly shakes her head.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Not yet. How about you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Same here! Listen, I picked up a new part today.
Mommy's eyes widen in surprise.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You're still going down there? Are you okay? Did you hurt yourself?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm fine!
I say, pouting at her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I was disassembling some appliance someone in the top side threw away, and I got just what I needed!
I lean against her bedside as I talk excitedly about my day.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I still don't have everything I need, but if I find more stuff, I can get the car moving!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Wow, that's amazing!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It'll be my first invention! Maybe no one ever thought of it before!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But I'll show you when it's ready, okay? Not before.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, I can't wait.
I go to the desk and grab something out of my bag.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And I got some new soap today! I'll help you wash your hair later.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Okay...
I try to hide the tools behind me so that Mommy doesn't notice them.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito?
I turn to her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah?
She smiles sweetly at me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Did you go to school?
I look down at the car I'm building.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Did you make any friends?
I silently shake my head.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I like working.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I can get parts for my inventions. Working is more fun than school.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: But I'm sure you'd have even more fun if you made some friends.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Maybe you can find someone to help with your inventions.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You may even make friends you can show your inventions to after I'm no longerâ€”

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're not going anywhere!
I shout back, still not facing her.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ah...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll become an inventor so we can live in the middle side. We'll get a doctor from there to look at you, and you'll get well again in no time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We can make your cells better with those artificial genes. So you're not going anywhere, right?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: ...Right.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: ...I can't leave you yet, no.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It's nothing, sweetie.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thank you for working so hard every day for us.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy, how much can you move today?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mmh...
After finishing dinner and wiping her clean with a towel, we start our daily routine.
We've been doing this ever since her legs stopped working.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: My fingers are... all good. I can move my whole right arm. On my left... I can move from the arm down.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You can't move your shoulder?
She makes a slightly pained expression from the exertion.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: ...No, I don't think I can.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see... But it hasn't gotten worse. At least that's good.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's okay. You're gonna be able to walk again someday, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When I become an inventor, I'll find out what's happening and find a cure. I promise.
She smiles gently at me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, I know you will. Thank you, sweetie.
Friends...
I remember what Mommy told me last night.
I'm sure she's worried because I have no friends.
I don't need any, but I don't want her to worry.
In my mind, I see the other kids from the lower side, the ones that come to work in the afternoon.
But I don't think any of them could be my friend.
Everyone's busy enough with their own families to care about others.
Looking for a chance to change their lives and move up to the middle side.
All the midsiders are young and beautiful.
The topsiders probably look the same too.
They combine artificial genes with chips in their bodies that monitor their health all the time. That's how they repair their cells as soon as they age.
But we lowsiders don't get medical care like that.
Maybe...
If we could improve Mommy's cells with artificial genes, she could move again.
The lifespan of the midsiders and topsiders is almost double that of us lowsiders, I heard.
That's why there's always such fierce competition whenever there's a vacancy in the middle side.
I think there are also fights when people try to move from the middle side to the top side, but it's more complicated, so I don't know much about it.
But since everybody's just looking out for themselves, there's no way we can be friends.
We're stuck in this pecking order. Making friends in a system like that is hard.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe I could invent myself some friends...
Like the android that's always walking behind Shachi.
Topsider families usually get one personal-use android per household, or sometimes one for each family member.
Would that count as a friend?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It'd be fun to have one, I guess.
Can you even make an android from scratch?
I wonder what the skin they have is made out of.
It's pretty rare, but apparently people sometimes throw androids that are beyond repair down to the dump.
I go there every day, but I've never seen one.
After finishing my morning work, I go down to the dump.
Maybe I can find another one of those turning metal thingies.
No one comes down here during lunch break.
It's more efficient to look now, before the afternoon garbage gets dumped.
I head down to the dump, not even taking the time to eat my lunch.
The dump is already full of stuff that wasn't here yesterday.
No androids.
I don't think one has been seen here in years.
There's no reason one would fall from the sky right now just because I need a friend.
Besides, I don't want something as big as an android today.
I start searching through the garbage.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay...
Of course, there's no way I'd be lucky enough to find three of the exact same piece.
But I manage to dig deep into the mountains of trash I couldn't get to yesterday and find four similar pieces.
And two of them still work when I flip the power on.
One of the other two didn't turn on when I flipped its switch. And the last, I couldn't figure out where its switch was.
All of them are slightly different sizes.
Maybe they were all made at different times.
I put the four pieces in my bag.
Now I have a total of five electric toothbrush parts in my bag.
Finding them took longer than I expected.
Maybe everyone got their afternoon jobs assigned already.
I leave the dump and run up the stairs to the middle side again.
I'm out of breath by the time I make it to the crowd of workers in the square.
I check for my name in the work sheets and find out I'm assigned to cleaning duty.
I guess I'm cleaning all day today.
The nice thing about working alone is that you can control how long the job takes.
If you finish early, no one minds if you take a break.
I'm in a hurry to disassemble all the toothbrushes I found.
I brought the base of the car I'm making with me too.
When I attach the moving wheels to it, it'll be a real car.
I pick up a broom and go to the west part of the square that I'm supposed to clean.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Hey, Octopus! You're not slacking off today, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: My name is Kaito. Like a kite in the sky.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Who cares about your name? You're an octopus now.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You're not gonna freaking fly anywhere, you're just gonna go wiggle into a hole down in the low side and stay there like the slippery, disgusting octopus you are.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...What's an octopus?
Is it some kind of toy?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Hah! You don't know what an octopus is?! Well, I guess you don't go to school! That's why you're so stupid!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm not stupid.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You downsiders are all stupid.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Octopus.
I carry on cleaning and try to ignore him.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Heheh.
Eventually Shachi goes off to make fun of the other downsiders, but Izumo remains where she is, staring at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Octopus are marine mollusks. They have eight legs. Although they are invertebrates, they are highly intelligent. They were also a source of food in various cultures.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh.
Then she falls silent, and just stares at me.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Izumo! What are you doing? I'm gonna smash your stupid head in!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Your friend's calling you.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: He's not my friend. "Owner" and "friend" are distinct classifications.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Izumo!
Izumo turns around and walks back to Shachi.
Even after they're gone, I continue staring in the direction they left.
Octopus are marine mollusks. They have eight legs.
Although they are invertebrates, they are highly intelligent. They were also a source of food in various cultures.
I can still almost hear Izumo's mechanical tone in my head.
It might be nice to have a friend like that, one who could tell you things you didn't know.
It would make learning a lot more fun.
I keep daydreaming about it as I clean.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, it's ready...
Just like I thought, the insides of the toothbrushes are pretty much the same.
All of them have that rotating part, a switch, and a power source.
Some work and some don't.
I swap some of the parts from one to another, until I figure out which is the power source.
The reason they're not moving is because there's no energy left in them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, I got them all!
Now I have for rotating metal parts.
And I've attached four wheels of the same size to one end of each of them.
I turn on their respective switches.
All of them work.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes, I did it!
I take out the base of the car and use putty to attach all the wheels.
I make sure to stick all the wheels to the four corners of the rectangular base.
It's getting closer and closer to the car I saw in the video.
I bet I can find something like what was on top of the car I saw in the video by searching through topsiders' trash.
The topsiders throw away all kinds of things I can't work out a use for. Most of it seems like pointless decorations.
I turn on the switches for each wheel one by one.
All of them start spinning rapidly.
I slowly put the car on the ground, and then...
It rushes off... in circles on the spot I placed it down on.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: H-Huh? I-It's supposed to go forward...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wh-Why?
Ahahah! That's funny!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?!
It's spinning round and round.
My head turns towards the source of the voice, and I see a girl with pure white hair looking at me.
I quickly pick the car back up and hide it behind my back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I-It's nothing.
Is that a car? It is, right? It wasn't moving forward, though.
Does she know about cars?
That's amazing. You made it yourself in the workshop?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How do you know?
Huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: H-How do you know it's a car?
Huh? I read about it in a history book.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh...
I read a whole lot, you know?!
History books?
Oh...
There's a kid other than me that knows about cars.
That car moves, right? It's incredible.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...It's still not done.
How did you make it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's a secret...
What?! Why?!
The girl howls at me.
But a second later she's all smiles again.
You're so smart! It's amazing!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No it's not. It won't even move like it's supposed to.
You didn't want to make a car that spins in circles?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wanted it to go in a straight line.
Why not try it again? Maybe it just didn't feel like it that time.
I look down at the car I'm hiding, think for a moment, then turn it on again and place it on the ground.
It just spins in place, same as before.
Look at that spin!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's a failure...
I pick the car up again and turn it off.
Let me take a look at it.
Just then, I hear another unfamiliar voice.
I turn and look up to see who it is.
The girl turns in the same direction as me.
Hi, Professor Asuma.
The man smiles at the girl.
He looks a little younger than Mommy.
The man she called Professor Asuma looks at the car in my hands.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You made that? Can I take a look?
I look down at my feet.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Hahah, I'm not gonna take it away from you. I'd just like to see the work of a tiny inventor.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...You mean me?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Who else?
I nod and hand the car to him.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Hahah, I see. You attached all the motors directly to the tires?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Motor?
The man makes his finger swirl in a circular motion.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This is what's called a motor. It has a magnet inside. When an electric current runs through it, the magnet spins.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: And you have all of these motors spinning clockwise right now. If you want it to run forward, you need to reverse the rotation of two of the motors on one side so they all go in the same direction.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If you put motors rotating the same way on both sides, the right and left wheels will spin in different directions, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, I see...
This is too complicated. I don't get it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But how do I do that?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If you reverse the direction of the current, the motor will rotate in the opposite direction.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You have any pliers on you?
I nod and take out some pliers from my bag.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'll cut the cables, okay?
I nod at him again.
The man cuts the cables connecting the two motors on the left side, switches them, and wraps them around the bare metal pieces.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It would be better if we could solder this bit.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But now it should run straight.
The man says, before crouching and putting the car on the ground.
The car wavers side to side as it moves in kind of a straight line.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's running! ...But it's stuttering.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The four motors all have different specs, and their batteries have different voltages. Each of the wheels is moving on its own, so it's not going perfectly straight.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Now, what to do? Perhaps you could use one motor to send the same amount of power to all four wheels.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How?!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: By using gears.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Gears?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Yeah, like this.
The man picks up a stick from the ground and uses it to draw something on the floor.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The rotation of one motor is transmitted to an axle with two wheels attached to it.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Now you've got only one source of energy and motive power. It's much more efficient.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If you want more power, you can connect two axles with a gear, so that the torque from one motor can power them both.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Torque?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Simply put, it's the power to make things rotate. Think of it like that for now.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You'd need a strong motor, but since the rotational force is transmitted to all the wheels, it'll keep going even if one of the wheels gets stuck in a hole.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's how four-wheel drive vehicles work.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wow, I see... So you only need one motor.
The man smiles and nods.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The most important quality of an inventor is being able to use your own brain and try things for yourself. And you did that magnificently. You should be proud.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But you also need to remember one thing a good inventor should never do.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What is that?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Try to reinvent the wheel, my boy. There's no point in wasting time inventing something that already exists.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I bet you would have liked to know about motors and gears sooner, right?
I answer with a nod.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We rely on the wisdom of those who came before us, and we stand on the shoulders of giants.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's why humanity made books and schools to pass down knowledge.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Here. This is your own precious invention.
The man returns my car.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Th-Thanks.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Keep at it.
See you later, Professor!
The man smiles at the girl and walks off.
That was great, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Who was that?
Professor Asuma. He's a school principal and a great researcher.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: School principal? He works at a school?
Hey, what's your name? Don't you go to school?
I shake my head.
I can't believe it! But you're so smart!
My name is Yonagi. It means 'calm world.'

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Calm as in a lull in the sea, so it means more like calm ocean. It's pretty, isn't it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's your name?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Kaito.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito! Like the name of the character in that picture book. I love that book!
I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's where it comes from. Me and my mom like it a lot.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's great! Does it mean anything?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Um, it's supposed to be like a kite flying in the sky.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So that one day I can fly up to the sky and bring all the people from the low side up to the surface, and we can all look at the sea together.
Even as the words leave my mouth, I'm already cringing with embarrassment.
In fact... Yonagi is just standing there, silently.
It sounds ridiculous.
I'm fully aware of it myself.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's awesome!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?
I look up and see her eyes wide open, glittering like shiny jewels.
For the first time, I realize her eyes are red.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Who named you?! I wanna know!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: My mom...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's so cool! I love it! Let's be friends, Kaito!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Why?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why?! I bet your mom is super amazing! She has to be, if she gave you a name like that!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And I bet you're a good boy if you have such nice parents!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's that supposed to mean...?
I look down at my feet again.
Hearing someone say such nice things about Mommy makes me so happy I could cry.
Yonagi's the first person ever to say something nice about her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We have really good names, don't you think?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: My daddy's the one who named me!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, there's the ration bell. Gotta go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're a lowsider too?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.
She nods, still smiling at me.
The midsiders and the topsiders get their food delivered directly to their homes.
Only the lowsiders have to get in line to receive rations.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay, I'm off. See you later!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: O-Okay...
She turns and runs off toward the middle side square.
What a strange girl.
And...
This has been the most interesting lunch break I've ever had.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Gears...
I try to recall the mechanism that Asuma guy explained.
I just want it to run straight first, so two gears should be enough.
One gear attached to the motor, and then another attached to the axle.
I could see why you'd only need one motor to power the car if you used this mechanism.
I wonder if I could have figured this out myself without that man's help.
Maybe not.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Reinventing the wheel...
Maybe there's a limit to what I can do on my own.
And...
Maybe attending school could help me become an inventor faster.
I slowly walk back home, rations in hand.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm back.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Welcome home, sweetie.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mm? Did something happen?
I nod, wordlessly.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: What is it? Anything bad?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Nothing bad. Just thinking of something.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I see. Do you want to talk about it?
I nod and sit by her bed.
Mommy patiently waits for me to talk.
I try to think of how to explain.
Where should I begin?
How should I say it?
I keep thinking for a while.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mmm...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When you were a kid, did you go to school?
When I ask, Mommy's eyes widen and she smiles.
The same gentle smile that she always has for me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yeah, I did.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And there were teachers?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Of course.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What kind of people were they?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Back when I was studying, there were a lot of teachers that were really good at making things.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yep.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Like how?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: For example, they taught us how to make our own bags.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah...
I look over at my bag, which is hanging on the wall.
Mommy made it for me when I started working in the middle side.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The teachers taught you that?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Just the basics, yes. Once you learn a few different ways to sew, you can make whatever you want with the right materials.
I remember the man's words again.
Reinventing the wheel.
The one thing an inventor shouldn't do.
That's why there are schools.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But there were topsiders and midsiders there, right?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, there were.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Did bad things happen?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Sometimes, yes.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: But it was still really fun. I made so many friends.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Friends...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes. We made clothes together, and we would wear them and play together.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Well, like you said, it wasn't all fun and games.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: But you know how I'm here all the time now, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: These days... I'm really jealous of the people that can walk outside on their own.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: If I had known this would happen, I would have liked to visit so many more places and see so many more things.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But the top side and the middle side aren't fun for us.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Even so, I think I would have liked to make sure of that for myself.
Mom patiently waits for me to talk.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Today... I failed at making the car.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Car...? You mean that little version of the thing people on the surface used to move around?
I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The car didn't run straight. I wanted to make it work on my own...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But I learned that people already found a better way to make cars long ago.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Someone taught me that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The principal of the school.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He told me that reinventing the wheel wasn't good.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Reinventing the wheel?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It means that I was looking for something that people already found a way of doing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Because I didn't know people had figured it out.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I realized that I'll never make anything new if I'm always focusing on things that might already exist.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You really are going to be an inventor. I saw it just now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I saw what you'll be like when you're all grown up.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You'll become everything you want to be. No matter what.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why? How do you know that?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I told you, I saw it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You don't know that.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, but I do. Mom always knows.
She says, smiling down at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's lots of books in school, right?
Mommy nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And there's also a place called a workshop, right?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Did that teacher tell you about it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The girl I met today mentioned it.
Her eyebrows rise when I mention the girl.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: A girl? Does she go to school?
I nod.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: What kind of girl?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know. We didn't talk that much.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She said she wanted to...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mhm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: To be friends with me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: And?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I didn't say anything back.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Do you want to be friends with her?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But...
I bet your mom is super amazing! She has to be, if she gave you a name like that!
I can still hear Yonagi's words in my head.
Just thinking about it makes me feel like I'm gonna cry.
I feel my throat tighten, but I manage to hold back the tears.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think I wouldn't mind being friends with her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, sweetie.
When I look up again, Mommy's smile looks brighter than ever.
I get a little shy and look down at my hands again.
Yonagi.
I wonder if I'll see her again today.
I mean, she has to go to the middle side.
We lowsiders aren't allowed to skip work without good reason. We're not allowed to take a day off just because.
That's our role in the system.
That's why everyone keeps doing their jobs, dreaming of going up to the middle side someday.
Above us is the middle side.
And above them, a really small number of top siders.
And above them, there's the big round blue sky.
At the end of the picture book, Kaito made it to a place where the sky and the sea went on forever.
The story ends when he's surrounded by nothing but the endless blue.
I wonder, though.
Will I ever see what he saw?
No, I can't think like that.
I'll get there, no matter what.
I lower my gaze a little.
I see the big mansions on the top side.
And then, lower down, the buildings of the middle side.
First, I have to get us there.
If I become a researcher, I can live in the middle side.
When I look straight ahead, corn stalks taller than my head fill my vision.
I can't see anything but this right now.
But someday, I'll get there.
I grip the strap of the bag Mommy made for me and walk up to the middle side.
My morning job is maintenance of the water pipes.
The ones in the west area are getting worn out.
It's been a year since I last did this kind of work.
I was working together with a group of adults, but all of them knew I don't go to school, so it wasn't awkward or anything.
When I go to gather some tools together in the square, I come upon a group of kids heading to school.
Shachi is among them, followed by Izumo like always.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Stop lazing around. We have enough slackers with your stupid mom.
Shachi hits me across the back of the head for no reason, and I hear some of the other kids laughing.
I ignore them, grab the tools, and leave.
The adults in my group stare as I make my way back to them.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Why don't you tell that bully off?
The nice old man who hands out the rations asks me.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Your mom's exempt from work, that right?
I nod.
He's looking straight into my eyes.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: If it bothers you, Kaito...

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Then you should go to school. Your mom's exempt from work, so you're allowed to go to school in the mornings.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Remember that.
Not knowing what to say, I simply stay silent.
The old man sighs and picks up a tool bag double the size of mine.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Let's get this over with.
Today's group is a good one.
The old man's instructions are so good that we finish the work in half the time it took last year.
I decide to use my extra time to look for gears in the garbage dump.
I wonder what kind of things I can disassemble to find the gears I need to make the car work.
I rummage through the trash.
There are some things similar to what I need, but I can't find one that's the perfect size.
I find one of those tools that adults used to use when making those black drinks they like.
It uses gears to transmit the rotations of the handle, but one of the gears is stuck to the frame, and removing it seems too complicated.
I continue searching and find a small wooden box.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's this?
Opening the lid, I find a lot of metal parts inside.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?
Looking closely, I see a metal shaft with spiral-shaped notches on it, and there's another part meshing with it.
It looks like a mechanism that's supposed to rotate.
It's not what I'm looking for, but maybe I can get something out of it.
I stow the wooden box into my bag.
Since we finished our morning work early, I have plenty of time to eat lunch.
I sit alone in a corner in the middle side and chew my dry tortilla.
After a while, the lowsider kids come spilling out from the school.
After most of them have passed by, Yonagi comes running to get her lunch.
She picks up a tortilla and looks for a place to sit.
That's when she notices me.
A satisfied smile spreads across her face, and she walks over to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hey.
I swallowed the tortilla and responded.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You didn't come to school?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I've never been there.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mmh...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can I sit?
I just nod at her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You've been working here all morning?
I nod again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I have to.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?
I finish the last bit of my tortilla.
Yonagi keeps staring at me from the side.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hey.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Aren't you gonna eat?
She still hasn't taken a bite out of her tortilla.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah.
The bell rings to signal the end of lunch break.
Yonagi rolls up the tortilla and stuffs it all into her mouth in one go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Your mouth is gonna get really dry.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wy kno... *Gulp*

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Heheh.
I can't help but laugh when I see her cheeks puffing out from all the food.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hahah! Ahahah! Hahahahah!
I can't stop laughing.
Yonagi stares at me with her cheeks full of food. Slowly, the corners of her mouth rise into a smile.
And then, her eyes twinkle and she starts laughing together with me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Heheh... Heheheh... *Cough* Hahah!
Unable to hold back her laughter, Yonagi ends up spitting all the tortilla that was in her mouth all over my face.
All. Of. It.
Absolutely shocked, I simply stare at her.
Her smile also disappears, and we just stare at each other for a whole minute. Then...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahah! Ahahahah! What's with the face?! Ahahah! You're all dirty and gross!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Y-You did this to me!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Gross Kaito! Ahahah!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're the gross one! Heh... Heheh...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahah! Hahahah!
We both laugh our butts off.
When we come to, we notice that even the adults around us are laughing.
The nice old man I was working with this morning is also letting out a hearty guffaw.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm on weeding duty.
We both laugh our butts off and then head to get our tasks for the day.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Me too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I gotta work with mascara de tortilla, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you mean?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I mean, the tortilla looked like a mask all over your face! Heheh. Ahahah!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was your fault!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I can't believe the evil mascara de tortilla stole my food!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What does that even mean anyway?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's Spanish!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? What? Why?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Tortillas are Mexican food, remember?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: M-Mexico?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's a country.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Country... Oh, i see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Got it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I still don't know why I'm mas-whatever de tortilla!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah, don't sweat it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Time to work!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Heheh, eheheh.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're laughing at me again.
Our afternoon task is pulling out weeds.
Yonagi and I have been assigned to it together, and she's still all smiles from the tortilla accident just now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Man, that was so funny. You're a comedic genius!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All I did was take a tortilla to the face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah!
What are you laughing at?
We both look behind us.
It's Shachi, with Izumo and some other midsider students behind him.
I notice that the kids all have bits of grass stuck to their clothes.
Maybe they were playing on the grass or something.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Look, it's the albino freak.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I told you to not call me that back in class.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Shut up. You lowsiders ought to shut up and work.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You topsiders must be so bored if you have to go roll around in the grass to have fun. That's sooo sad.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: I'm searching for something! I wouldn't come to this filthy slum if I didn't have to!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What're you looking at?!
Shachi glowers at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Nothing.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Albino freak.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Don't ignore me!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm not an albino freak. My name's Yonagi.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: But you're an albino, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are you that desperate to talk to a girl? Do they usually run away from you?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: I'm a topsider! Everyone loves me!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What is it?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That sounds really, really lame. Maybe you shouldn't say that out loud.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Ugh!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah...
Shachi hits her over the head.
Just like he always does with me.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Th-That was your fault.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Because you're talking back and slacking off!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And why does that mean you can hit me?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The topsiders don't have any right to punish us lowsiders. You don't even know that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We lowsiders work because it's our duty.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Did your parents not bother to teach you that?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You stupid albino freak.
The words no sooner leave his mouth than Yonagi approaches him menacingly.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't want to be called that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Stop calling me something I don't want to be called.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Don't you dare.
Yonagi stands firm and stares him down.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hmph.
After a moment, Shachi turns his back on us.
He quickly leaves without another word.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Stupid twerp!
Yonagi shouts after Shachi's gone.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...That was amazing.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I mean, uh, how you stood up to him.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Even you're gonna say that?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well, uh, but he's a topsider.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Who cares?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If I could choose for myself, I'd choose being a lowsider with a job to do every single time!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? Because it's fun! Food tastes so much better after a good day's work!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's way better than just sitting around doing nothing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I would choose to be a topsider if I could.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?! Why?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I want to see the sky from up there.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The sky?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And the topsiders can see the outside from the bulge of the ozone lens!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I want to see what the surface is like with my own eyes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So you're interested in the surface.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Of course! Everyone is!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Well, I'm not!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're weird.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Says mascara de tortilla.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm interested in something way, waaay more romantic than the surface!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Heheh.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Love!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Love?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Love that makes your chest get all warm and fuzzy wuzzy when you think about it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Fuzzy wuzzy?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's what I want.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You know Shakespeare?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sh-Shake spear?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: He was a huge genius!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's something that can spread out infinitely, even inside here?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, err, a virus?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa, what a downer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Imagination!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Excitement! Heart pounding! Flashy fun!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If you close your eyes, you can imagine all those feelings and be wherever you want, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Excitement...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I like it better that way.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're kind of weird. Really weird, actually.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You think so? I don't think I'm that weird.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think everyone here thinks about the surface.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Well, it's not like I wouldn't like to see what's up there.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But rather than what you see, isn't it more important who you see it with?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, it's where you see it from.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No! You're wrong!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whatever. Let's just finish work already.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right-O.
We keep pulling out weeds in silence.
After we're done, we go to throw them in the dump.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Man, this place sure is full of trash.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's a bunch of stuff that can still be used.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. Even if it's broken stuff, sometimes you can get good parts out of it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? Even though it's trash?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. I look for stuff that people can use and trade it for food.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The rations we get are never enough, so I search for things to trade with here.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There's a lot of stuff in the school's workshop. I don't use it a lot, though.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're talking about school again?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.
We go back to the middle square to report that we've finished our work.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There's still a while left till it's time to pick up the rations.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I've got something to do.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What is it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...A secret.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I thought we were friends!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: W-We are?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? We're not?
She tilts her head to the side and looks into my eyes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Didn't I say we yesterday that we should be friends?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, but...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And you even caught all of my tortilla with your face!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What does that have to do with anything?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How doesn't it?! You're telling me you'd take a tortilla to the face from just anyone?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't want to get food spat on my face even from a friend!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Makes sense!
I take out the base of the car from my bag.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, it's the car.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wanna try out what that man said yesterday.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You mean Professor Asuma?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You found gears?
I fish out the wooden box I picked up this morning.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll disassemble this to get them.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ooh, show me!
I pass it to her.
She looks at the box from every angle before opening it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa, it's a music box!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A what?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's called a music box!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But it looks like it's broken. This part here is supposed to spin and make a nice sound.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're gonna take it apart? I think it's really pretty.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. I can replace the parts I take out later. I just want some of them for the car right now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, I see.
She hands the box back to me.
I take out my flat-head screwdriver and begin taking the music box apart.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There, I got it.
I put the spiral-shaped shaft with notches on it and the gear that meshed with it on the palm of my hand.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oooh!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Now I attach this to the motor. See? This shaft thing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It turns, see?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ooh!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Now...
I remove the four motors from the car's body.
I also remove the wheels attached to the motors.
I choose the fastest of the motors and attach the gear to its tip.
Then I use putty to attach tires to both ends of the shaft, and position the motor and the power source so that the gear will mesh with it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It looks like clay.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's putty. It's harder than clay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're so good at this!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I've spent a lot of time doing this stuff.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's turning!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa!
It's incredible.
The rotation of one motor is transmitted to the two wheels.
The gear transmits that rotation to the shaft, and in turn, makes the wheels turn.
The parts look beautiful working together at such high speed.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's make it run!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah...
I gingerly place the car on the ground.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oooh!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's running!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's incredible! You're a genius!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's working!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's show it to the Professor! I'm sure he'll love it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're super smart! I bet you can get chosen for the engineering course!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's where all researchers start out!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really? Lowsiders can enter?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If you study enough, yeah!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see. So I could become a midsider that way.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's not the part that matters! It means you can become a scientist and research whatever you want!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It doesn't matter if you're a midsider or a lowsider or whatever.
I don't think that way.
I'm just amazed that there's a concrete way to get to the middle side.
Or at least a chance.
Suddenly, that's all I can think about.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: An engineering course...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Does that Professor from yesterday teach it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I think so, maybe.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hey, why don't you come to school?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Because I have no friends.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Awh...
She squints at me and pouts.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You are my friend, though.
Yonagi beams at me upon hearing that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But it doesn't seem fun to go to school with those guys, though.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What a waste!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But you don't like them either, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If you like working, you could just work all day like me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I like working, but I like reading lots of books just as much!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wanna read lots of books, but it'd be such a waste if I didn't just because I'm scared of some jerks!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's not like I have any friends in school either.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.
I assumed she had lots of friends.
Since she's so bright and cheerful, I figured she'd always be the center of attention.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You read books in school all day?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You wanna study more too, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You looked like you were having tons of fun listening to Professor Asuma yesterday.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was fun, yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Then let's go to school together!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But...
I look down at my handmade car.
I do wanna see that workshop.
I didn't even know lowsiders could become researchers.
But...
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I can't go. I have to work for my mom too.
Yonagi looks surprised.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She can't walk.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's why I have to work for two people.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Is she sick?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Doesn't she have an exemption from work?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She does, but...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?
I hang my head, but Yonagi tries to peer into my face from below.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They say my mom's slacking... It makes me so frustrated...
The expression drains from her face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Who said that to you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Shachi. That's why I work instead of going to school.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito.
Yonagi says my name calmly.
She looks into my eyes and slowly shakes her head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's the same as accepting that they're right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Why?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Everyone who lives in this city has the right to not work if they're sick like your mom.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I get why you feel that way, but what you're doing won't solve anything.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And I don't think it makes your mom happy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why not?! How would you even know that?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I just know. I know how it feels.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito, let's go to school together, okay?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sure you can stand up to all those dummies.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And I'm sure you'll have fun! You can learn so many things from reading, and you can make whatever you can think of!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's what school is for.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay?
The smile returns to Yonagi's face.
I give her a small nod.
Seeing this, her smile spreads even wider.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, I'll try.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes! Yes!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll put in an application when it's time to get the rations.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll ask if I can go to school in the mornings, starting tomorrow.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Of course you can! You have the right to!
Before lining up for rations, I talk to the people that decide on the tasks we do every day.
One of them is the nice old man who helped with the maintenance of the water pipes.
When I say I want to go to school, all the adults there seem happy and relieved at the news.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: That's good. You ought to be in school at your age.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah... Thanks.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Don't let those topsiders spook you. You're a talented young man if I've ever seen one.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: If they dare say anything about your mom, you bash their faces in! We're all on your side here, sonny.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay. I'll do my best.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Go and hit those books!

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: You can get up there, I just know it.
I never imagined all the people I work with would be so supportive.
I pick up my rations and go back to Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How did it go? Did they say it's okay?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes! Then let's go together! I can show you around.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.
We both walk through the fields with our ration pots.
All the other kids except for us are walking with their parents.
All of us lowsiders do some kind of labor.
The men usually work in power generation plants or factory zones at the end of long tunnels, and they don't come out for days at a time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hey, so...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are you like me?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Your mom and dad don't seem to be around.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Neither of them?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Nope. I used to live with my dad, but he died.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So you're alone?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, but I have all the stuff they left behind, and I can keep eating as long as I work.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Aren't you lonely?
If Mommy died...
I don't think I could take it.
I don't even want to imagine it.
But Yonagi shakes her head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I have a lot of fun. And now you're my friend too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Mhm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's go to school together starting tomorrow, okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We can meet at the elevator tomorrow morning.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.
We agree on a time to meet.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I gotta go this way now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wanna come play at your house sometime, so you better tell your mom all about me!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: O-Okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: See you tomorrow!
Yonagi shouts before running off along a dirt street rimmed by tightly-packed buildings.
I see her off and then continue on through the cornfield.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And then her cheeks puffed up like this! They were all round!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When I laughed, she laughed, and she spit out the tortilla all over my face!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: No way! Hahah!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She spit out all of it! I couldn't believe it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi was laughing so hard, and so was I, and then everyone in the square was laughing.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ahahahah!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And then Yonagi called me Mascara de Tortilla all day, even though it was her fault!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mascara de Tortilla?
I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She says it's Spanish. Because tortilla is a Mexican food.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oooh. I... see?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
When I got back home, I spent the whole evening talking about Yonagi.
Mommy simply listens to me with a smile on her face.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yonagi knows so many things, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. She said she reads a lot.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think she's as smart as me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: That's incredible!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I'd like to meet her sometime.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll tell her tomorrow. She said she wants to visit too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll see her tomorrow at school.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You're going to school tomorrow?
I hang my head and nod.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, I see.
I say nothing, my head still down.
Mom gently strokes my hair.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ask her tomorrow then, okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. Can you read me a book today?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Sure, what do you want to read?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The one about Kaito. From the beginning.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Sure thing. Bring the book over here.
When I present the book about Kaito's adventure to Mommy...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ah...
Her left arm was hanging weakly at her side.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Hmm... I can move my right hand. My left hand too. My right arm is... fine.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: But my left arm... Nngh, ah...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ugh...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You can't move it?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: No, though I can move my fingers.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You could move everything below the shoulder before, right?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ngh...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But maybe it'll start moving again tomorrow. Maybe you're just tired.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: ...Right.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thank you, sweetie. Why don't we go to bed for tonight?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.
Mommy stares out the window for a while.
Maybe she's having a hard time falling asleep.
But after a while, I hear her breathing even out.
After making sure she's asleep, I put the car on the desk.
I flip the switch, and the two wheels start turning.
I turn it on and off several times to make sure every part of it works properly.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Good...
Now there's only one thing left.
The part that covers the top.
I recall the car I saw on the middle side's monitor.
The part that glittered under the sunlight.
I don't think I can make that from putting spare parts together.
What is it even made out of to begin with?
Metal? Plastic?
Yonagi said there's lots of books in school.
Can I learn what I want to know there?
I want to learn about cars.
And, most importantly, I want to find out what Mommy's illness is.
I didn't know there were so many books at school, or that lowsiders could read them too.
I lie down and stare at the ceiling.
School...
I think about Mommy's arm again.
There are so many things I need to learn about.
I want to get us to the middle side.
I want to get Mommy the help she needs.
After packing my bag as usual, I turn back to Mommy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm going now.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Take care out there, sweetie.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Do your best.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I will.
I walk to the elevator at the center of the low side.
My pace picks up almost to a run without me even realizing I'm doing it.
It's strange.
It's the same road I walk to work every day, but my steps feel so light today.
I'm nervous, but...
I'm looking forward to seeing Yonagi by the elevator. I can't wait!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah.
When I arrive at the elevator, Yonagi's already there waiting for me.
Noticing me, she smiles and waves.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Good morning.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You came!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Y-Yeah.
I find myself fidgeting with the strap of my bag for some reason.
I notice that Yonagi has something strange in her hand.
It looks square, angular, and looks to be made of a hard material.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I've got something I'd like to ask you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can I take a photo of you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A photo? You mean like... a photograph? With one of those machines that record still images?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah! This one prints the picture as soon as it takes it. Nifty, huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's really old!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So, can I take a picture of you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, why?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Because I wanna take one!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But why?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Come on! Don't be like that! Face this way! I wanna see a big smile!
Yonagi says as she points the camera at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uhh...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Come on, I can only take so many pictures! You gotta make it count!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: R-Really?!
My eyes widen in surprise, and the device Yonagi's carrying makes a clicking sound.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah, funny face!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why can you only take a few photos?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Because I don't have more of this paper. See?
The little black box spits out a piece of white paper from a slit at the bottom. Yonagi takes it and starts flapping it around.
A faint image of me starts to appear on it.
Little by little, it gains color as she flaps it around.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's amazing!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: After I finish using what I have right now, there'll be no more paper left.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It was from my dad.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How many sheets do you have left?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's a secret!
If she's taking pictures of me, she must have a whole lot of them left.
I mean, it's just me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay, good. I'm glad you let me take a picture of you.
Yonagi carefully puts the photo away, like it's a precious treasure.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: O-Okay.
We ride the elevator then walk together through the middle side.
Normally, I'd be working by now.
I can see some lowsiders cleaning the roads, actually.
I walk with Yonagi until we come upon a big, symmetrical building.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This is school?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You've never been here?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No... I always worked.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Then that makes you my junior! Here's where the school and the research institute are.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So the researchers work here?
I look up at the big building.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This side is the school, and the other one is the research institute. We can't go into the institute, by the way.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's go to the classroom first.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Classroom?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We all get together in the mornings there. We lowsider kids are free after that, so we can go to the library.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah. Only the midsider and topsider kids have fixed classes. Poor things.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I think people should be allowed to study whatever they wanna study.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I think the same.
Yonagi's eyes widen at my answer, then she smiles and nods.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's go.
I follow Yonagi to the classroom.
The room is larger than I expected.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's sit down.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Lowsiders sit by the back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, so we're kept apart here too?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, the topsiders sit at the front, then the midsiders, and then us.
We sit side by side along the back wall of the classroom.
Students enter the classroom one after the other.
Some are smaller than us, and some are bigger.
The seats gradually fill up.
The seats for us lowsiders are all occupied, so the other lowsider kids begin standing at the back instead.
There are still a lot of empty seats in the topsider and midsider rows.
I see Shachi enter the classroom.
Shachi and Izumo go to one of the topsider seats, and the others who came along with him go the midsider seats.
Most of the topsiders like Shachi have androids with them.
I hear a ringing sound I'm not familiar with. In the end, the empty topsider seats remain empty.
Professor Asuma enters the classroom shortly after.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The first thirty minutes are Professor Asuma's history lesson.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: History?
All the topsider and midsider kids have the same images displayed on their terminals.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Textbooks.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What are they for?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: They have what the teacher is talking about written down in them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't have one of those.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You can always read it in the library.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, okay.
Looking around, I notice that none of the lowsider kids have terminals.
The one I have back home is something I picked up from the dump.
The lowsider students probably aren't given their own terminals.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Last week I explained the discovery of paraglucose and its glycolysis pathway. Today, I will talk about the impact they had.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Paraglucose is an artificial sweetener that was invented in 2075. Its chemical formula is very similar to those of glucose.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This artificial sweetener is synthesized from the monosaccharides found in ancient microbes that were discovered frozen in the permafrost of Antarctica.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: At the time, this artificial sweetener was groundbreaking in two ways.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: One reason was that this component could serve as an energy source for the brain. Until then, artificial sweeteners affected the brain in no discernible way.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Until that time, glucose was the sole known source of energy for the brain. Since the brain is an organism that functions constantly, our bodies need to keep breaking down food for glucose to send to the brain.

texts.name: Asuma
