texts.text: Just like our heart, our brain doesn't stop working, even while we sleep. Whether we're conscious or unconscious, it's always working.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Even the hunger we feel is an unconscious command from our brain that influences us.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We obey these commands from our brain, and eat to provide it with nourishment.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Like a lowsider.
Laughter bubbles up from the front rows.
But Professor Asuma doesn't look amused.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Thousands of years ago, humankind didn't always have stable access to sustenance. The history of humankind is also the history of its fight against hunger.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's why our bodies have multiple layers of mechanisms to store glucose. That's the way our bodies evolved.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: On the other hand, when there's an excess of glucose and the blood sugar level rises too much, the only way to suppress it is for the body to produce insulin.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: When this natural safety check fails, a person suffers from a disease called diabetes. When humanity was still above the ground, the prevalence of diabetes in developed countries was an ever-rising concern.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Even after developing agriculture and establishing a stable supply of food, the habit of impulsively eating whatever is in front of you never disappeared.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The evolution of a species is basically irreversible. Once a change develops, there's no way to roll it back.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's why people had to learn to restrain themselves. To stay healthy, of course, but that wasn't the only incentive.
The professor looks over the classroom.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It was because the humans of the surface deemed obesity to be unappealing.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: To have the self control not to overeat despite having a near inexhaustible source of food at your fingertips was perhaps valued as a symbol of spiritual virtue.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: On one hand, there was the brain and its ancestral impulse to try and secure a stable intake of glucose, and on the other, the collective aesthetic sense of humanity that dictated what body shapes were appealing.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: There was constant conflict between these two sides.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Sounds like a war between humankind and their brains, doesn't it?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: In the end, though, mankind won the war. After the discovery and subsequent mass production of paraglucose, that is.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That said, that too was an achievement born from the ingenuity of the human brain. You could say the brain simply got tired of arguing with us.
There's laughter in the classroom.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Now, moving on to the discovery of paraglucose and this new process of glycolysis. What made it so revolutionary was its ability to nourish the brain, and only the brain.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This new glycolysis process only occurred within the brain.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Inside the brain, paraglucose became a biological energy source called ATP, which supplied energy directly to the synapses.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Paraglucose supplied the brain with energy, but in the rest of the bloodstream, it was simply expelled as waste.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It was tested on any number of animals, and in no case was it found to accumulate in the body.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Only the brain can make use of it, so the rest of the body just expels it.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Its properties were simply staggering. No matter how much of it you had, you wouldn't get fat, there was no risk of diabetes, and the brain was supplied with more than enough energy.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But this was not the only reason the paraglucose exploded in popularity. Why else do you think that was?
Asuma scans the room for a moment.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Its taste.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Paraglucose simply tasted good, and that's what really sealed the deal.
There are some giggles and murmuring in the classroom.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Other artificial sweeteners up to that point would be, say, for example, 5000 times sweeter than sugar.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The artificial ones might seem to have an overwhelming advantage in terms of sweetness. But there was something odd about their taste.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's said that most people could distinguish between normal sugar and artificial sweeteners.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But no one could tell the difference between sugar and paraglucose.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Paraglucose was the only one that deceived the human tongue, and as such it was adopted almost immediately.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It spread all over the world so fast that soon, there wasn't a person out there who hadn't tasted it.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But what no one realized was that paraglucose was a mutagenic agent. In other words...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: No one realized how it was mutating the genes within human germ cells.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: By the time these effects were noticed, mankind had been consuming paraglucose for around two generations.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Humanity was evolving without anyone being the wiser.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Let's wrap things up here for today. I'll explain the details of what came after in the next lesson.
The professor closes the machine that was projecting images onto the board behind him and leaves the classroom.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Paraglucose...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We only get lessons with him once a week. You sure are lucky. That was fun, wasn't it?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay, we're free now! What do you wanna do?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, there's no more?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Nope. They say there aren't enough classrooms or teachers. But if you go to the library, you can watch videos of old classes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll show you around since it's your first day. Then let's go to the library and read books together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, thanks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We can go the workshop, then the roof, and then the library. Let's go!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This is the workshop!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, I see.
I drink in the sight of each of the workshops as we walk around.
There are so many tools and machines that I've never seen before.
My interest is especially piqued by one of them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's this?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hm, good question.
It's a hollow, square box.
There are a bunch of round things lined up around it.
Its shape reminds me of the cars I saw on the monitor.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe it was made here, with these tools?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe. Now, let's get going.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: W-Wait! Not yet!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But we've gotta take a look at the rooftop, read in the library, and then go to work!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We're gonna run out of time!
That's a printer.
I look back and see Professor Asuma standing behind me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, hello, Professor.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I don't often see you in here, Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm showing my friend around.
Professor Asuma smiles fondly at Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: U-Um, Professor?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Y-You said it's a printer?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Press that button there, would you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This?
I press the button he's pointing to.
There's a strange noise, and the screen on the side of the hollow box lights up.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This device holds scan data of the main manufactured goods that we humans had in the surface era, so that we can recreate the lives we had up there.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It can make whatever you need. You just need to input the right data, scale, and color.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And what about those things around it?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: These items have been printed using that data.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Amazing!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Would you like to try making something?
I nod sheepishly.
Professor Asuma smiles at me, then does something with the machine.
The next moment, a semi-transparent image appears inside the box.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Is this what you wanted?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah...
It's a car.
A roundish base for a car.
It's what I wanted to make, but..

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Um, the shape is a little more like this...
I trace the shape I envisioned with my finger.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Like this?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes!
Now the display shows the same shape as the car I saw on the middle side monitor before.
In the video, there was a happy family riding in it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's it! Yes...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: What color would you like?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Um, yellow. A kind of dark yellow, if you can...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You can turn the little knob here to change the color. Go ahead and try.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: O-Okay.
I turn the knob and make it the same color as I saw on the monitor.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: How about the size?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: U-Um, I want to put it on this...
I rummage inside my bag and take out the base of the car.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Oh.
His eyes sparkle when I show him the little car atop the palm of my hand.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You repaired it. Mind if I take a look?
I nod and hand it to him.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Amazing. You even found the right parts for it. You didn't make any of these parts, did you?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I picked them up in the dump...
I remember what Yonagi said yesterday.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I took the parts out of a music box.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Oh, a music box, huh? I see...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Can I turn it on?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Hahah! Incredible! It's really well done.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Now we need to give it a good chassis.
The professor takes a ruler out of a white cabinet and carefully measures the small car.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Okay, I know what size we need now.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Here you go. Thanks for showing me.
After handing the car back to me, the professor inputs some numbers into the machine.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Don't look away now. This is the fun part.
He takes a step back so that the machine is in full view for both me and Yonagi.
White lights come out from the back and the right-hand side, and little by little, the body of the car materializes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa! Amazing!
In no time at all, the body of the car is right there, behind the clear screen.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: When this meter is empty, it'll be ready. It's cooling off right now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Cooling... It's hot in there?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Very hot.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's ready now. Open it up.
When I pull on the handle he points me to, the transparent screen opens.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa, it's amazing!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Your car's complete now. It's an SUV.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: SUV?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It stands for Sports Utility Vehicle. See how it has space at the back to load up baggage?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Back when people lived above ground, they use to move their bodies by using different tools. This entertainment was called sports, and so they called this a Sports Utility Vehicle.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can I put it on the car?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Of course.
I take some putty out of my bag.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Hmm, is that putty? The kind that's used to repair the water pipes?
I nod.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You can use this one. It's putty for handicrafts.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: There are various types of putty you can use depending on the task you want to accomplish. You can have this to keep.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Th-Thanks...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Must be nice. Hmph!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You want some too, Yonagi?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, no, I'm fine. I wouldn't use it for anything.
The professor chuckles at Yonagi's comment and then turns to me.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The switch is inside, right? You should make it so that the chassis is removable.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see. Okay, so...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: See these hooked parts on the inside of the chassis? Try to make it so that they hook onto the frame.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay...
I fix the SUV frame onto the car with putty.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's done!
I look up. The professor is smiling down at me.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's great.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Th-Thank you!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: No, I didn't do a thing. This is your work.
I turn to Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's done! Check it out, Yonagi!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah! It looks great!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's make it run!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? What about the library?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We can go after!
I start running, hugging my bag to my chest.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We won't have time! Kaito!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wait, you forgot your music box!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Geez!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Hahah, he's a good boy. I can see him becoming a researcher.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi, this way! The rooftop is here, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, but wait for me!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Look!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This is it! It's just like I saw it in the video!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You seem super happy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm very happy!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's kind of contagious, heheh.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Good thing you came to school, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah!
I chase the SUV as it runs along the floor.
I'll show it to Mommy.
I worked so hard because I didn't want to show her something unfinished.
And finally...

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Nnh...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah!
My little car hits Shachi's shoe and comes to a stop.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What are YOU doing here?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Shouldn't you be working?
I hear Yonagi come running up behind me.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What's this? A car?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's... my...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Give it back. Kaito made that.
I look fearfully up at Shachi.
But I'm surprised to see that his attention is not on me.
Instead, he's staring at what Yonagi has in her hands.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Why do you have that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: That's a music box, right? That was in my house! Show it to me!
I look back over my shoulder and meet Yonagi's gaze.
I can see the unease in her eyes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I found it in the garbage dump, soâ€”

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Dirty liar! No one threw that way! Give it to me!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was in the garbage! It was broken!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah...
Shachi snatches the box from Yonagi's hands.
Then he opens the lid and looks inside.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You broke it didn't you? What did you do to it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was already broken, so I took some parts, but Iâ€”

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You broke it! You're the one who did this!
Suddenly, memories of Shachi coming back from school covered in grass come to me.
Maybe that's what he was looking for.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: How dare you break my things? You dirty lowsider.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You piece of trash!
Shachi shouts as he grabs my car and raises it above his head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Stoâ€”
He slams it down on the hard floor before I can even say anything.
I simply stand there, stunned.
I feel the tears begin to swell in my eyes.
Within seconds, they fall down my face and make a puddle on the floor.
One after the other.
The pool of tears keeps getting bigger and bigger.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito...
Crouching down, I frantically try to gather all the broken pieces.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: I'll make you regret this.
With that, Shachi leaves.
An unfamiliar set of legs appears in my field of vision.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Here.
Izumo places another piece of the broken car in front of me.
I put down my bag.
Then I pull out the putty from inside.
I wipe my tears away.
But more come.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What are you doing? You're fixing it?
I silently nod.
I try to stick the frame together with the putty Professor Asuma gave me.
But they won't stay together.
I try using the putty I was originally using too.
The frame starts getting uglier and uglier.
I cover the motor and power source with putty as well.
But when I flip the switch, nothing happens.
I rub the tears from my eyes again and peel off the putty.
When I take a spare motor out of my bag and try to install it, the gear I had attached to the last one splits apart.
Just that light pressure was enough to break it in two.
I grit my teeth.
The gear is one of the most important parts: it's the part that transmits the rotation of the motor.
Wiping my tears yet again, I set myself to fixing the gear first.
I put some putty on the gear where it broke. But now it's the wrong size.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito... It's almost time for work. We need to go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You can go.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll come after I fix it...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But...
I keep working on the car, tears streaming down my face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll wait with you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: *Sob* Ngh...
I don't even know what I'm trying to do anymore.
I've spent so long trying to put the car back together.
I figured some things out.
The gears need to be strong, because there's a lot of pressure on them.
Once one breaks, you need to replace it with a new one.
Which means...
I can't fix it right now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ngh... *Sob*
I learned that when you cry for too long, your throat and head start to hurt.
That no matter how much you try to hold back tears, they'll just keep coming.
That once you start crying, it's hard to stop.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: *Sob* Ugh...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's go. We've gotta go home.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Your mom must be worried.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I wanted to show her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She can't go see the... *Sob*... middle side monitor, so I...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I-I thought... *Sob*... that the car on the monitor looked so cool...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wanted to show it to her... So I made one...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I made it... I-It worked, and...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But now...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I can't even fix it now... *Sob*
I stand up and wipe my tears.
My sleeves are soaked.
Yonagi stands next to me and looks at the broken car by my feet.
It looks okay, but it doesn't work now.
It's just an empty shell that can't move anymore.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...It won't run anymore?
I slowly shake my head.
Yonagi silently picks the car up.
Then she takes my hand gently with her free hand.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's go. Can you walk?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Your house is this way?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah...
She keeps holding my hand the whole way.
I walk a little behind her, trying my best to wipe the tears away.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Corn sure grows big, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Mhm.
Her hand felt cold at first, but now it's warm.
Her soft hand is wrapped firmly around my own.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wanna know what I think?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sure you'll make something even more amazing someday.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: More amazing?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes. Something that will make people smile!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I know you can make it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know about that...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We can ask Professor Asuma to let you use the workshop from now on. You'll have everything you need!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No one will ever accuse you of doing anything bad ever again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So don't cry anymore.
Yonagi's voice falters.
It stops me in my tracks.
Her tone is filled with worry.
I upset her too.
I don't even know what I'm feeling anymore.
The memory of Shachi smashing the car down flashes through my head again.
The way he glared at me, his eyes full of scorn.
Why is it so clear in my mind? How can I recall it so vividly?
When all I want to do is forget...
The more I think about it, the clearer I see that image of the moment the car broke. All those bad emotions keep filling my chest, making me dizzy.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito.
I sense Yonagi approach as I hang my head, trying to stifle my sad sobs.
I can see her toes as I look down at the ground.
She stands on her tiptoes, like she's stretching upward.
And then, I feel something soft touch my forehead.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?
The feeling is followed by a gentle warmth.
The same one I felt as we held hands.
Her scent envelops me.
A soft, gentle scent that's a little different from Mommy's.
I feel the sensation of her lips on my forehead.
It melts away the cover of sadness shrouding my heart, replacing it with a calm that fills me completely.
And then, all I feel is her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You stopped crying.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: M-Mhm...
As she pulls back from the kiss, I notice she's blushing a little.
I probably am as well.
My face feels hot.
She smiles at me, cheeks still tinged with pink,

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm so glad you stopped crying.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We can go to the workshop and make another one.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But we have to take turns going to the library and the workshop, okay?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Next time it'll be my turn to show you what I'm making.
I raise my face to look at her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Your turn?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What are you making?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Heheh.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You wanna know?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: A story!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm making my own story!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll show it to you tomorrow.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are you excited for it?
Oh, so you can make your own stories. I never thought of that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are yooouuu?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Great!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, is that your house?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can I come with you?
I give her a small nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hi, Mommy.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Welcome baâ€”Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Good day!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Good... day?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: My name is Yonagi.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ooh!
My mom exclaims in delight, to Yonagi's joyful surprise.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: So you're the Yonagi I've heard so much about.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes! Good day! Err, evening!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Good evening.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can I come in?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Of course! I've been looking forward to meeting you!
Yonagi turns to me in surprise.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yep.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You're as cute as a button. Just like Kaito said!
My head snaps up to look at Mommy.
Yonagi glances at me, a satisfied smile spreading across her face.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I never said that!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, you didn't?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I could tell you were thinking it, though.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: D-D-Don't lie!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah!
Yonagi and Mommy laugh together.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You said you wouldn't mind being her friend.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I guess I did say that...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Eheheh.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You're all he talks about these days.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? Really?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's not true...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Like the tortilla incident.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah, right! When it got all stuck to his face.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You spat it on my face! Your cheeks were this big!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You can speak other languages, Yonagi?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, Kaito, what was it? The mascara thing?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mascara de Tortilla?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's Spanish!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Spanish? Hmm...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's a language from a country called Spain. I can't speak it, though. I just read a book called La Mascara de Zorro.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Wow!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wait, was it La Mascara DEL Zorro? I kind of forgot.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But that's where it comes from! Tortillas are like, the national dish of Mexico, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And since they spoke Spanish in Mexico, Kaito became Mascara de Tortilla!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That makes no sense!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You know all kinds of things, huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I love books! And stories!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Hmm!
I stare at the car Yonagi's still holding.
Yonagi notices and offers it to me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito.
I take the car from her and stare down at it.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Is that the car you made?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Can I see it now?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Um, Kaito's Mom... You know? The car he made was working, but it got broken.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh...
Mommy quietly looks down at me for a minute.
I keep looking down to avoid meeting her gaze.
And then...
I feel my eyes tearing up again.
The car was finally right here in my hands, yet I've already lost it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy, I...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Someone broke it before I could show it to you.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Someone broke it?
The tears roll down my face.
I just stare down as they fall by my feet.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I see now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Um...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you, um, think you could... keep a secret?
I raise my face.
Yonagi's staring at me, her expression serious.
Next, I turn my teary eyes to meet Mommy's.
She looks a little puzzled.
I probably have the same look on my face.
But we both nod.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, I can.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Me too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Then give me your hands.
We present our hands to her.
Yonagi takes hold of my left hand and Mommy's right hand.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You two hold hands too.
I hold the hand that Mommy can't move.
Now we're making a small ring.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Close your eyes.
After exchanging a glance with Mommy, we both close our eyes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay, here goes. Don't get spooked, okay?
Her gentle voice sinks into me, permeating my body, and then...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?
The car is running.
It's gliding across the smooth rooftop floor.
It's just like what I saw earlier.
But the angle is different.
The outlines of the vision sharpen, becoming clearer around the car.
I'm there too.
I'm smiling.
I'm happily skipping away, chasing the car.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This is it! It's just like I saw it in the video!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You seem super happy.
I'm talking in the vision now.
I also hear Yonagi's voice.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm very happy!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's kind of contagious, heheh.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Good thing you came to school, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah!
I keep chasing the car.
And then, it ends.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What...
When I open my eyes again, I'm back home.
Mommy's eyes are as big as plates.
It was like we were right there on the rooftop.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What was that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's kind of like a memory of what I saw today, maybe.
Mommy and I are lost for words.
We've never experienced anything like it before.
We remain frozen in place, slack-jawed.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Um...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: One day I just realized I could do it. But I was told not to, because it would scare people...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Who told you that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: My dad.
The one that passed away.
She said that he's the one who named her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why I want to keep it a secret.
Clearly nervous, she starts fidgeting with her fingers.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...That was amazing.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It was!
Yonagi raises her face and looks at us.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's incredible! How do you do it?! How does it work?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Uh, h-how it works? I don't really know myself.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It wasn't scary at all! You have a wonderful power!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thank you, Yonagi.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You helped me see my boy out there enjoying himself. I want you to know that it made me really happy!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wanted you to see the car, not mâ€”
I don't finish my sentence.
I can see tears shining in Mommy's eyes.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It made me so very happy. Thank you so much.
Mom uses her good hand to clasp Yonagi's tightly.
Yonagi is taken aback for a moment, her face flushing.
Tears well up in her eyes too.
She's probably crying for the same kind of reason Mommy is.
Yonagi keeps bobbing her head at her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Eheheh.
Then she wipes her tears and looks back at us with a bright smile on her face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm glad you liked it! You're welcome!
Time goes by in a flash as we keep talking, and before I know it, it's already dark outside.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yonagi, shouldn't you be getting home soon?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Don't worry! I live close!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hey, wanna have dinner here?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? Are you sure?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, we've gotâ€”
And that's when I realize.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Aaaah!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Uh, wh-what's wrong?!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The rations...
I murmur, turning back to Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We didn't get them...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We didn't go to work either.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Because you spent the whole afternoon fixing the car!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do we do now?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What do you have? Let's make something.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mommâ€”Ah, Kaito's Mom, can I use the kitchen?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Of course! Kaito's the one who always cooks, and I would love it if he had some help.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What do you have?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Um, corn flour, and, uhh...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What can we do with this?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hmm, we have beans and cheese. That's pretty much it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wanna make tacos?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Tacos?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What? You don't know tacos?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't think we get those in the rations.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay! Kaito, you make the tortillas. I'll make the filling with the beans. You have seasoning, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Chop chop! I'm hungry, so let's get to it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I-I know.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Heheh.
After eating Yonagi's homemade tacos, we clean up, and she gets ready to leave.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thank you for having me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You'll have to come by again soon!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, I will!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Next time, I'll read you a picture book as thanks for today!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really?! The one about Kaito?
Mommy looks surprised upon hearing this.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi likes that one too.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I see!
She smiles at me and turns back to Yonagi.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Sure, I'll read that one for you!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yay! When can I come?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Whenever! I'm always here.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Tomorrow?!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, feel free to drop by!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes!
Mom smiles as she sees how happy Yonagi is.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: See you tomorrow then!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: See you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You too, Kaito!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You say bye to me last? Hmph...
I accompany her out of the house.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are you sure you're okay by yourself?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, it's fine! The moon is bright tonight.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks for today.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm really happy you were with me. Thank you...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's fine! That's what friends are for!
Her bubbly, confident tone is back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And sorry.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: For what?
She stares at me curiously.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: For making you skip work.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, it's fine! Let's go apologize before going to school tomorrow.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's meet in the middle square tomorrow before school, okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, thanks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But tomorrow we go to the library, not the workshop, okay?
She makes me smile.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I wanna read books too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hey, Kaito.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I was right. Your mom's really cool!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
I nod decisively.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She's amazing, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito, do you think I could maybe...
Yonagi looks down and fidgets with her hands again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Would you be mad if I called her Mommy too?
She looks up at me for a second, then casts her gaze back down.
I smile and shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wouldn't mind if it's you.
Yonagi looks up at me, her eyes full of expectation.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think she would like it too.
When she hears that, her mouth widens into a full smile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Then... tell her for me! Tell her I'll be here tomorrow!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.
Yonagi waves goodbye as she enters the cornfield.
I watch her run off between the tall corn stalks until she's out of sight.
